title: Community Affairs Intern
requirements:
Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new standard for the tools upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team.

We are looking for an intern to join our Community Affairs team. You will be partnering with our VP of Public Policy & Community Affairs to research topics such as community policing, the police reform movement, community engagement with public safety agencies, and more. Throughout your internship, you can expect to work on a variety of different projects, including product-focused user research and documentation, industry research, and content creation. Some of your research and work may focus on researching opportunities to add community engagement functionality into our software platform. You will collaborate closely with many other team members within program management, product development, and design, while also working autonomously on research and writing projects of your own.

What You'll Do

If you were part of our team, here are some things you would have done last week:

Set up social media alerts for topics relevant to your research
Spent time researching the current state of law enforcement data available to communities
Analyzed data to support your findings and synthesized them into relevant themes
Created a presentation that packages your research in a way that can support influencing product and messaging decisions
Designed surveys to seek information from community activists engaged in the police reform movement
Collaborated with Mark43 Designers in user experience brainstorming sessions to bring research findings to life through ideation
Created content (thought pieces, white papers, blog posts) to support continued engagement with both communities and customers
Conducted interviews with current customers and community leaders


What You'll Need

We're looking for someone who is passionate about Mark43's mission and understands the role technology can play in improving relationships between law enforcement agencies and the communities they serve. You should have strong research skills (background in academic research a plus) and strong writing instincts that will allow you to distill complicated topics to core compelling elements. We expect you to have some experience doing market research to support product development and strategy and using Microsoft and Google products to document and present your findings. You should be comfortable working autonomously, and be able to make progress on projects with little oversight. Prior internship or professional work experience is required. Sociology, Business, or Criminal Justice majors may be well suited for this internship.

People who thrive on our team also tend to share the following characteristics:

Humble, open, and curious. You work without an ego and value others' opinions and experiences.
Self-motivated and hardworking. You know how to assign and organize your own work and you always deliver on time.
Interest in technology, civic, and public safety issues. You enjoy engaging in thoughtful conversation around the topics facing the public safety industry.
Comfort with ambiguity. You enjoy experimentation and are able to thrive working within a rapidly changing environment.
Respectful communicator and active listener. Your communication skills will allow you to respectively engage and interact with many internal and external stakeholders on the different topics you're researching.


Our Community Affairs team is based in Baltimore, MD but our team is working remotely right now and this will be a remote internship. There still may be opportunities for local or regional travel if and when it becomes safer to do so.

Community Outreach Intern is a person who wants to improve his or her community. The Intern lives in the community where he or she will help the residents. Depending on the duration that the Intern needs to spend in a certain community, the candidate has to be prepared physically and emotionally in dealing with a new group of people. title: Community Affairs Intern
requirements:
Mark43's mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new standard for the tools upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team.

We are looking for an intern to join our Community Affairs team. You will be partnering with our VP of Public Policy & Community Affairs to research topics such as community policing, the police reform movement, community engagement with public safety agencies, and more. Throughout your internship, you can expect to work on a variety of different projects, including product-focused user research and documentation, industry research, and content creation. Some of your research and work may focus on researching opportunities to add community engagement functionality into our software platform. You will collaborate closely with many other team members within program management, product development, and design, while also working autonomously on research and writing projects of your own.

What You'll Do

If you were part of our team, here are some things you would have done last week:
• Set up social media alerts for topics relevant to your research
• Spent time researching the current state of law enforcement data available to communities
• Analyzed data to support your findings and synthesized them into relevant themes
• Created a presentation that packages your research in a way that can support influencing product and messaging decisions
• Designed surveys to seek information from community activists engaged in the police reform movement
• Collaborated with Mark43 Designers in user experience brainstorming sessions to bring research findings to life through ideation
• Created content (thought pieces, white papers, blog posts) to support continued engagement with both communities and customers
• Conducted interviews with current customers and community leaders

What You'll Need

We're looking for someone who is passionate about Mark43's mission and understands the role technology can play in improving relationships between law enforcement agencies and the communities they serve. You should have strong research skills (background in academic research a plus) and strong writing instincts that will allow you to distill complicated topics to core compelling elements. We expect you to have some experience doing market research to support product development and strategy and using Microsoft and Google products to document and present your findings. You should be comfortable working autonomously, and be able to make progress on projects with little oversight. Prior internship or professional work experience is required. Sociology, Business, or Criminal Justice majors may be well suited for this internship.

People who thrive on our team also tend to share the following characteristics:
• Humble, open, and curious. You work without an ego and value others' opinions and experiences.
• Self-motivated and hardworking. You know how to assign and organize your own work and you always deliver on time.
• Interest in technology, civic, and public safety issues. You enjoy engaging in thoughtful conversation around the topics facing the public safety industry.
• Comfort with ambiguity. You enjoy experimentation and are able to thrive working within a rapidly changing environment.
• Respectful communicator and active listener. Your communication skills will allow you to respectively engage and interact with many internal and external stakeholders on the different topics you're researching.

Our Community Affairs team is based in Baltimore, MD but our team is working remotely right now and this will be a remote internship. There still may be opportunities for local or regional travel if and when it becomes safer to do so
